{"step_by_step_thinking": "Serum is the liquid portion of blood that remains after the blood has clotted and the clot has been removed. It does not contain clotting factors or fibrin, which are involved in the clotting process. Serum also does not contain red blood cells (RBCs) or other cellular elements of blood. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Blood-all cellular elements.", "answer_choice": "D"}
